intro: Urostachys pollucis, commonly known as the silverleaf flax, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in loose spikes, which bloom in early summer. Urostachys pollucis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
